result.execSummary:
The defendant Rashawn C Roushia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 5 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.
***Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law prior being released from jail.***

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rashawn C Roushia

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rashawn C Roushia in court with attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski.  Defendant Rashawn C Roushia in custody.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Plea - Ct.1 - G.
BTC: Ct. 1 - GUILTY.   Ct.2 - DRI.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen prior being released from jail;
$300+cc+DNA, pp $25/mo beg 1-1-16, ftp 5 days RCJ for contempt.

Pre-trial conference at 10-01-2015 03:15 pm.
Status conference at 11-02-2015 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   ***ALSO $1,500.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** No contact with the victim, WP (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Rashawn C Roushia in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Rashawn C Roushia in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
